She wants to buy flour, rice, sugar, and other fast-selling goods. She’s grateful for the opportunity she’s getting because it will be of much help for her to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy flour, rice, sugar, and other fast-selling goods.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 57 years old, married and has four children. He does crop farming and keeps dairy cows to earn a living. He has been farming for two years.  He has managed to educate his children with his previous loans from Faulu Kenya.
Simon hopes to increase his cow herd for more milk production. He has requested 100,000 KES to buy cows and animal feed.

loans.use: to buy cows and animal feed.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en: Mwaka is widowed and has two grown children. She has a business for over 15 years selling fruits and vegetables. Mwaka conducts her business at the central market in her town. She has a good set of casual customers which allows her to maintain a profitable business. With the loans from Yehu, she has been able to increase her inventory that she sells to her customers. As a result of working in her business, she has been able to accomplish her personal goals such as improving her business and making renovations to her home. With this loan, she will buy tomatoes, kale, bananas, etc.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, kale, bananas, etc.

loans.name: Saidi

texts.en:
Saidi is 39 years old. He owns a store where he sells goods such as drinks, basic grains, flour, bread, rice, and other products. His family also earns an income from his wife, who earns a salary as a teacher. Saidi is a hardworking man who strives to move forward. 

Saidi is requesting a loan from Yehu to invest in his store and buy new products in greater quantities than his is currently able. He will buy flour, bread, rice, sugar, and other products. In the future, Saidi hopes to move forward and improve his financial stability.

loans.use: buy flour, bread, rice, sugar, and other products

loans.name: Rama

texts.en: Rama is requesting a new loan to expand his general store. He used his previous loan to add to his inventory and his living standards have improved. Rama says that most of the people in his vicinity prefer coming to his shop because of his reasonable prices and the fact that he even gives out some goods on credit, especially to his neighbors. Rama will use his loan to buy biscuits, wheat flour, cooking oil, and other fast-selling goods.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, wheat flour, cooking oil, and other fast-selling goods

loans.name: Jonny Obied

texts.es: Jonny tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus padres en una aldea del municipio de la Masica, Atlántida. Jonny de muy pequeño realizaba trabajos de agricultura, pero los ingresos no eran suficientes y decidió hace 6 años establecer su propio negocio y poner en práctica sus habilidades, el tiene un taller de soldadura donde fabrica portones de hierro, balcones para vivienda, techos de canaleta, trocos de hierro, ventanas de celosías etc. con el préstamo que ha solicitado va comprar más herramientas y materiales que necesita como hierro, pinturas, y electrodos, para la fabricación de portones , balcones, otros trabajos de soldadura que le solicitan los clientes. Su objetivo es llegar a tener un negocio fuerte y crear una fuente de empleo y de ingresos para dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Jonny is 27 years old and single.  He lives with his parents in a village in the Masica municipality in Atlántida.  Ever since he was very little Jonny has been doing farm work.  However, he did not get enough income.  Six years ago he decided to establish his own business and put his skills to work.

He has a soldering workshop where he makes iron gates, balconies for house, gutters for roofs, steel beams, and latticework for windows, etc.  He will use the loan he has requested to buy tools and materials that he needs like iron, paint, and electrodes to make the gutters, balconies, and other soldering work that his customers request.

His objective is to come to have a strong business.  He wants to create a source of employment and income in order to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy iron, electrodes, paint, and some tools he needs for his soldering shop.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.pt:
Casado e mãe de 6 filhos, 2 dos quais ainda frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 sobrinhos e noras que vivem com ela.
É reformada do Ministério da defesa. Com este empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (ferro, chapas de zinco, cimento, blocos, blocos e outros) para continuar a ampliar a sua casa.
No futuro deseja adquirir uma viatura para fins comerciais, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a falta de fundos suficientes para satisfazer seus projectos.
texts.en:
Mariana is married and the mother of 6 children, 2 of which still attend School. She lives in her own house with her family and supports 2 nephews and daughters-in-law who live with her. She is retired from her post at the Ministry of Defense.

With this loan she intends to purchase construction materials (iron, zinc sheets, cement, blocks and others) to continue to expand her house.

In future she wishes to purchase a vehicle for commercial reasons and to this end, commits to duly paying off her loan in order to solicit more loans from Hluvuku.  Her challenge is the lack of sufficient funds to complete her projects.

loans.use: purchase construction materials (iron, zinc sheets, cement, blocks and others) to continue to expand her house.

loans.name: Maame Ekua

texts.en: Maame Ekua sells palm oil and dry pepper at Eguafo. She is married and has 3 children.  Her husband is a farmer. Maame has been selling dry pepper and palm oil for 15 years. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their utility and housing bills. She will use her loan to buy pepper, and to buy palm fruit and extract the palm oil, to sell in her business. She hopes to use the added profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy pepper, and to buy palm fruit and extract the palm oil, to sell in her business.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba sells rice porridge that she serves with bread at Putuubu near Cape Coast. She is married to a driver and has 3 children. She has been selling rice porridge for 6 years now.  She uses her income to help her husband to feed, clothe and pay her children's school fees.  Her loan will be used to purchase bags of rice and flour to prepare her porridge and  bread to sell. With the new profit, Araba will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and flour to prepare her porridge and bread to sell.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba sells banku. She serves it with fried fish, pepper and tomato sauce at Putubiw near Cape Coast. She is married and has 3 children. She has been in this business for 2 years.  She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their utility bills. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing her banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing her  banku for sale.

loans.name: Christiana's Group

texts.en:
This is a group of two women, 38 and 39, who sell provisions and underwear. 
Christiana is a 39-year-old Ghanaian woman. She is married to a 52-year-old driver and they have three children.
Christiana sells her items in the community and has nine years' experience, working Monday to Saturday, morning to evening. She is constantly working to improve her business capital. This is her sixth loan with ID-Ghana and she needs 900 Ghana cedis to buy soap, disposable diapers and sauce pan items to sell to customers. 

They need a total of GHC 1,350 to be able to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, disposable diapers and sauce pan items to sell to customers.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 38 years old and lives with his wife and six children in a rental house with both electricity and running water. He is a very enterprising man who owns his own store where he sells household products and basic goods. Paul's business is located in his home and enables him to have everything he needs to live in a stable manner with his family. 

Paul is requesting a loan through Yehu to buy larger quantities of products such as drinks, bread, sweets, flour, detergents, cereals, and other goods that are most sought after by his customers. His biggest desire is to increase his sales because his profit enables him to support his household.

loans.use: to buy quantities of products such as drinks, bread, sweets, flour, detergents, cereals, and other goods

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is 23 years old and has two children who are in school and economic dependents. She makes her living sewing clothing for regular and occasional clients. Mbeyu's business is in her home and she makes articles of clothing such as dresses, blouses, and skirts. She also repairs worn-out clothing. 

Mbeyu is requesting a loan to buy sewing materials such as fabrics, threads, and other items. Her loan will enable her to maintain economic stability in her business and her home.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials such as fabrics, threads, and other items

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 39 years old and is divorced with five children who are currently in school. She lives in Tiribe and works selling dried shark. Amina has run her business for over ten years and is well-known. She gets her merchandise from the municipal market in the city.

Amina is requesting a loan to buy more stock of dried shark to sell. In the future, her goal is to continue to expand her business. She knows her loan will help her to grow.

loans.use: to buy more stock of dried shark to sell

loans.name: Naomy

texts.en:
Naomy is a mother of six and a widow who lives in the rural area of Tiribe. She has been selling coconuts for over 10 years. In addition to this business, she also sells juice in her neighborhood. Naomy is a hardworking woman who sells her goods door to door. Despite the challenges she is facing, she does not give up in life. What she knows is that hard work has rewards. She has to continue working to hold the burden left for her when her life partner passed on.

Naomy will use this loan to buy more coconuts for sale. Her dream is to see her two youngest children complete schooling since the others are through with their studies.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 38-year-old Betty from Moriba town in the southern area of Bo, Sierra Leone. She is married with three children between the ages of 3 years and 15 years. Her children attend school. She began this business because she wants to take good care of her family.

Betty runs a dried fish business within a business market area. She sells dried fish. She has been running this business for 10 years. She works at the business every day; she will start to smoke the fish from 11:00 p.m. until the fish get dry. She also has two relatives who help her to run the business. Her business is the only income she has. Betty says that the main challenges to her business are the cost of transport and insufficient capital to expand her business.

Betty has requested a loan in order to buy more fish for sale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and open a savings account. In the future, she plans to export dried fish and build a house for her family. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: buy more fish for sale.

loans.name: Mwikali

texts.en: Mwikali is a very hard-working woman who, since she was young, has worked her hardest to get ahead and to achieve a stable life. She lives with her two children and her husband. Mwikali sells household products in an open-air market. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase more merchandise such as sweets, biscuits, and other items, and thus to obtain better supplies for her business. She promises that, with better supplies, she will have increased earnings, which will help her family.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise such sweets, biscuits, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Ms Shehnaz is an active 35-year-old woman who has enjoyed her work of making ‘Gol Gappe’ for 10 years at her home. It is a popular street food dish in a country like Pakistan. It is a round, hollow puri, fried crisp and filled with a mixture of water, tamarind, chili, chaat masala, potato, onion and chickpeas. It is small enough to fit completely into one's mouth. She makes it on a daily basis and has become famous in her town. 

Her husband’s income is insufficient to meet the family's expenses because he is employed as a sales person in a garment shop. So she initiated her own business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Now she requested a loan of Rs 15,000 to buy ingredients in bulk, such as semolina, plain refined flour, baking soda and oil to meet the increasing demand for her food item. She hopes to earn more profits and will use the profit on the betterment of her family.

loans.use: To buy ingredients in bulk, such as semolina, plain refined flour, baking soda and oil to meet the increasing demand for her food item.

loans.name: Mesaidi

texts.en: Mesaidi is an entrepreneur who sells fruits and vegetables. She does this activity from her home. She says that thanks to the support that she has received, she hopes to increase her merchandise and her customers. Right now Mesaidi is asking for a loan to buy mangoes, oranges, cabbages, tomatoes, potatoes and other products to stock her stall. She is a responsible person who always wants to get ahead and provide for her four children.

loans.use: to buy mangoes, oranges, cabbages, tomatoes, potatoes and other products.

loans.name: Lizzy's Group

texts.en:
Lizzy's Group is a self-help group made up of 8 members. The members of Lizzy's Group are all women from Teshie in Accra-Ghana. They formed this group to support the welfare of its members. They sell fish, second-hand clothing, and sandals.

Agnes is a 38 year old woman living with her husband and three children. She sells fish at her residence. The fish business moves very fast because fish is a perishable commodity. She sells different types of fish, based on the demand from her customers. She has requested a loan of 400 Ghana cedis to purchase more fish to sell. She has a very good relationship with her customers, because she learned about customer care from ID Ghana.
This is her 4th loan from ID-Ghana.

The group needs a total loan of 2,500 Ghana cedis for use in the members' businesses.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Marionito

texts.en: Marionito is a married man with 3 children. He is 39 years old and resides at Kinangay Sur, Clarin. Marionito owns and operates a transportation service business to earn a living. He has been 16 years in this business. Each month, he earns 8,000 PHP doing this type of business. He requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase spare parts. Marionito has been a member of GDMPC since 2009. In the future, Marionito hopes for business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Ma. Consuelo

texts.en:
This is Ma. Consuelo, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Arnel, a mason and a father to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ma. Consuelo retails processed meat products. What she basically does is buy processed meat products from a wholesaler, then she sells them per piece/pack with a profit. Products can range from ham, hotdogs, processed pork and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. She also has a variety store. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 800 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Ma. Consuelo hopes her variety store will become a grocery store through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Pinky

texts.en:
This is Pinky, a resident of Silang, Philippines. She is married to Edy, a technician and a father to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Pinky has a phone accessory business. She offers different phone accessories like batteries and chargers. She also sells slippers, undergarments and shoes. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 22,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional stocks of cellphone accessories and other products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Pinky hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years and dreams to give her children a good quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for phone accessories, slippers and other personal products needed in her business.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife, age 41, operates a business raising hogs. She has been engaged in this work for the past four years and has taken out three loans from NWTF to sustain her business. She and her husband have four children, two of whom are enrolled in school.

Marife has requested a PhP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Marife would like to save sufficient money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ursula

texts.pt:
Viúva e mãe de 1 filho já não frequenta Escola, vivem na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta sua sobrinha que vive com ela.
É reformada e negociante. Com este empréstimo pretende comprar produtos de primeira necessidade (arroz, farinha, amendoim, feijão, óleo e outros) para comercializar em outras províncias do país. 
No futuro deseja construir uma sala de eventos no seu novo terreno, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria como forma de subir a sua renda mensal.
texts.en:
Ursula is a widow and the mother of 1 child who is no longer in School, lives in her own house with her family and supports a niece who lives with her. She is retired and a trader. With this loan she plans to buy essential products (rice, flour, peanuts, beans, oil and others) to sell in other provinces of the country.

In future she intends to build a room for events on her new property and to this end, commits to duly paying off her loan in order to solicit more loans from Hluvuku. 

Her challenge is to increase the quantity of her merchandise in order to increase her monthly income.

loans.use: buy essential products (rice, flour, peanuts, beans, oil and others)

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru:
Бактыгул 39 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Бактыгул в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес 14 лет назад с суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Бактыгул в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 2 дойные коровы с приплодом, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 5,000 сом (KGS). 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бактыгул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Бактыгул планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса посредством увеличения поголовья племенного скота.
texts.en:
Baktygul is 39 years old, married and has 4 children. As the main breadwinner of the family, she has been engaged in animal husbandry for the last 14 years. She began with a sum of only 15,000 Kyrgyzstan Som (KGS). Thanks to her persistent hard work, her farm now includes 2 dairy cows and their calves, and brings in a monthly income of around 5,000 Som.  

For the purpose of further developing her business, Baktygul has approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan in the amount of 20,000 Som to buy cattle to fatten and re-sell. In the future, she plans to re-invest the profit generated into her business by buying breeding stock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia is 39 years old and married with three children. Dionesia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell. Dionesia has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from vegetable vending. She has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Dionesia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a married woman with 5 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Alicia is 44 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Alicia has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 14 years. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing equipment.

In the future, Alicia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo, age 49, is a rice farmer. He and his wife Bellania have been engaged in this business for two years and earn about PhP 35,000 per crop season.

He is asking for a loan of PhP 40,000 to buy farm inputs such as rice seedlings, fertilizers, and insecticides to foster the proper growth of his rice crop and to ensure successful rice production. 

Danilo and his wife are confident that this loan will help them to further develop the business. Their goal is to adequately provide for the family's needs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as rice seedlings, fertilizers, and insecticides

loans.name: Shuru

texts.ru:
Шуру 55 лет, вдова. Шуру в качестве источника дохода для своей семьи, еще в советское время начала заниматься полеводством  и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 500 советских рублей. Благодаря упорному труду Шуру в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 2 дойные коров с приплодом, 20 голов мелкого рогатого скота, 2 лошади, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 5,000 сом (KGS). 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Шуру обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 115,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку 10 овец для откорма и перепродажи и 2 нетелей.  Доходы от кредита Шуру планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса посредством закупа дополнительных голов скота.
texts.en:
Shuru is 55 and widowed. To provide for her family, Shuru started raising crops and animals back in the Soviet times, having started the business with 500 Soviet rubles. Thanks to Shuru's hard work, her farm currently has 2 dairy cows with calves, 20 sheep and goats, and 2 horses. Her monthly income from the farm is around 5,000 KGS.
To develop her business further, Shuru has requested a loan of 115,000 KGS from Bai Tushum & Partners to buy 10 sheep for fattening and resale and 2 heifers. She plans to invest the income from the loan into her business by buying further heads of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sheep and 2 heifers

loans.name: Leta

texts.pt:
Divorciada e mãe de 2 filhos, 1 ainda frequenta Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É negociante vende produtos alimentares diversos. Com este empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (peixe, arroz, bolachas, farinha, amendoim, feijão, óleo e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja construir uma casa tipo dependência para aluguer e adquirir uma viatura para transportar seus produtos, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é liquidar o empréstimo o mais rápido possível para poder solicitar mais.
texts.en:
Leta is divorced and the mother of 2 children, 1 of whom still attends School. She lives in her own house with her family and doesn't support anyone else.
She is a trader and sells various food products. With this loan she plans to buy essential products (fish, rice, biscuits, flour, peanuts, beans and others) to increase the quantity of her merchandise.

In future she intends to build a house for renting out and acquire a vehicle to transport her products. To this end, she commits to duly paying off her loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku. 

Her challenge is to pay back this loan as quickly as possible in order to ask for another loan.

loans.use: buy essential products (fish, rice, biscuits, flour, peanuts, beans and others)

loans.name: Santos

texts.en:
Santos is an artisan who specializes in Huichol beadwork. He has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story: My name is Santos. In the language of our people, my name is Witxeteme, which means "young eagle." I live high in the sierra with my family and we travel to the city to sell our work since no one comes up here. Our entire community works in farming, but we make beadwork articles to sell since life in the village is difficult. Everything we put on the figurines, gourd bowls, and pictures is part of what we believe. The designs help the gods understand our prayers. I believe in my customs and I help in the fiestas and participate when the men go hunting. My goal is to become a "curandero," or healer, so I can help my people, those who are ill.

Santo is requesting a loan to invest in a bulk purchase of glass "chaquira" beads and wooden mask molds. He adds, "thank you for offering us the opportunity of this microcredit. It will benefit many Huichol families."

Use the link below to view Santos's Huichol beadwork on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=3898

loans.use: to purchase glass beads and wooden mask molds in bulk

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is a Mexican artisan who specializes in handmade ceramic lamps. He has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story: My father was a driver for a company that built highways and that job brought us to an artisan town in 1966. I was astonished by people’s ability to transform a simple pile of earth into diverse and wonderful ceramic objects. I'd visit the workshops to watch and learn the way they worked. The first money I earned went to buying a bag of dried clay and pigments and I asked a local artisan to teach me. At the age of 34, I decided to dedicate all my time to handicrafts and I set up my own workshop behind the family home my parents built.

Ismael is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of raw materials such as clay, paste and paints. He adds, "thank you for putting your trust in me with this microcredit. It allows me to keep growing and doing what I am passionate about."

Use the link below to view Ismael's ceramic lamps on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=8326

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of raw materials such as clay, paste, and paints

loans.name: Umu

texts.en:
Umu is 35 years old and married with two children, ages five and 12. For the past eight years, she has sold plastic and rubber shoes and slippers at a busy market in Kuland town in the southern area of Bo, Sierra Leone. Umu's husband is also a businessman and he helps her support the family and run the business. Her major business challenge is that the road network to her area of operations is very poor.

Uma is requesting a loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy a variety of rubber slippers and shoes to increase her inventory. The extra income from her loan will help improve her life and her family's well being. In the future, Uma would like to see her business grow and she would like to have a big house and become rich. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy a variety of rubber slippers and shoe to increase her inventory

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Andrés de sesenta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo es apto para la siembra y esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola, comercializa en diferentes partes de la localidad, en  el mercado municipal y agencias de compra y venta, se ha hecho de mucha clientela y las personas lo prefieren porque todo el producto es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además con un servicio excelente; Andrés es un hombre emprendedor, dedicado a su labor, siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas  oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar un futuro mas prospero, día a día se esfuerza al máximo pues sabe que solo así lograra el éxito que tanto desea, en la ultima cosecha tuvo algunas perdidas pero necesita recuperarse y en esta temporada de siembra quiere aumentar la inversión por eso le solicita  INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz y frijol, insecticida, herbicida, herramientas, etc. Andrés tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Andrés is sixty-five years old and lives with his life partner.  He makes a living farming corn and beans, and has been working in agriculture for several years.  This has given him a lot of experience that allows him to reap the best harvests.  The farming soil is suitable for sowing seeds and is situated in a very fertile area.  He sells in different parts of the community, in the municipal market and to wholesale agents.  

He has many customers, and they prefer him because of his high-quality products, affordable prices, and excellent service.  Andrés is an enterprising man, dedicated to his work, and is always on the lookout for new opportunities that will allow him to have a more prosperous future.   

Day by day, he works himself to the maximum because he knows that only by doing this will he achieve the success he wants.  At the last harvest, he had some losses, but he needs to recover.  In this sowing season he wants to increase his investment.  

He is requesting a loan to buy corn and bean seeds, insecticide, herbicide, tools, etc.  Andrés has good payment references and is sure he will be able to pay off the debt.  He has faith that he will bring economic security to his home.

loans.use: to buy corn and bean seeds, insecticide, herbicide, and tools

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en:
Ariel is 37 years old. He is married and has two school-aged children. He has been involved in the farm business for 20 years. He has one and a half hectares of land, where he grows rice. He sells his harvest to traders and earned about 35,000 PHP from his last crop. The income from it helps him to cope with the needs of his family and give his children a higher education. 

Thus, Ariel wants to obtain a loan in the amount of 25,000 PHP to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and rice seedlings. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested to further the growth of his business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and rice seedlings

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 37-year-old Rugiatu from Kulanda town in the southern area in Bo. She is married with four children between the ages of 10 and 19. Her children are currently attending school. For the past 15 years, Rugiatu has run a business selling baby clothing, baby powder, and cream. She works ten hours a day and seven days per week and her business is her only income. Rugiatu says that the main challenge to her business is the slow purchasing power of her customers.

Rugiatu is requesting a loan to buy more baby items such as baby powder, cream, and clothes. The extra income from her loan will allow her to start a savings account and educate her children. In the future, Rugiatu would to become an international businesswoman. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: buy baby items such as baby powder, cream, and clothes.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is the widowed parent of seven children. She works hard to support her family. Carmelita works buying and selling bananas in the Philippines and also earns additional income from running a general store and farming coconut. She has been sustaining her businesses with the help of her previous 14 loans through NWTF.

Carmelita is requesting a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional bananas to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is married to Eduardo. They are both farmers working in the Philippines and they earn about 30,000 PHP every crop season. 

Marilyn is asking for a loan in the amount of 48,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and seedlings and to pay for labor needed for rice-planting. She and her family believe that this loan will be an enormous help to their hopes of increasing their yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings and to pay for labor needed for rice-planting

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is married to Joana. He and his family live happily in a village and have a plan to raise their standard of living. Farming is one of their major sources of income; they plant and harvest rice for sale. They have been in this business for more than eleven years and usually earn a profit of 35,000 PHP in each harvest season. 

At this time, Ronald is asking for a loan of 35,000 PHP to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides and to pay for the labor needed for rice-planting. Ronald believes that this loan will be an enormous help to the family's hopes of increasing their yield.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides and to pay for the labor needed for rice-planting

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
With his desire to improve his family's living situation, Michael has devoted himself full-time to his rice farm business for eight years. He is 30 years old and is married to Marife, who also sells vegetables in the local community for additional income. They work hard to give their two children a good quality of life and to lift them out of poverty. 

Now Michael is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for his rice farm business. He hopes to increase his yield with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for his rice farm business

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en:
Ferdinand is 58 years old. He is married and has four children. They live in Nagrumbuan, where he manages their rice field. He has been in his farm business for 20 years. He received 36,000 PHP from his last crop. His wife also raises hogs for additional family income. They are both thankful because the income they generate from their businesses helps them to meet their daily needs. 

Now, Ferdinand is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP in order to purchase rice seedlings and fertilizers for his rice farm business. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested and he is promising to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase rice seedlings and fertilizers for his rice farm business

loans.name: Edmund

texts.en:
Edmund is 31 years of age and is married, with two children. He has grown rice for five years and he usually earns 25,000 PHP for every crop. Edmund is a responsible father who's willing to do everything possible to lift his family from poor living conditions. His wife’s name is Melanie. She helps him to cultivate their rice field. 

At this moment, Edmund wants to obtain a loan of 22,000 PHP to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and rice seedlings and to pay labor costs for planting. Edmund hopes the loan will lead to a greater rice harvest so he can better provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and rice seedlings and to pay labor costs for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to change the electrical installation.

loans.name: Yolly

texts.en:
Yolly is single with no children. He is 30 years old and lives in Highway Lawis, Panalsalan, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, Yolly has a transport services business. He has had this business for three years. Each month, he earns approximately 7,000 PHP.

Yolly has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP. Yolly has been a member of PMPC for one month. In the future, Yolly hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance and spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester, 32 years of age, is married and blessed with three children. She has a rice farm, which she has owned for six years. From the last crop, her net income was 35,000 PHP. She's asking for a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase additional fertilizers and seeds for her rice farm. 

Future loans from Kiva would be invaluable to Ester, who sees the loans as her only opportunity to develop her agricultural business and improve her financial security.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and seeds for her rice farm.

loans.name: Misael

texts.es: El Sr. Misael de 34 años trabaja en una maquiladora de la localidad como operador de una línea de producción desde  hace un año,  es divorciado y vive con un hijo de 3 años que su ex esposo le dejo a su cuidado; él quiere ser un padre sueña con ver crecer a su hijo y poder brindarle una carrera universitaria que le permita tener una calidad de vida mejor que la que ahora tienen;  Misael tiene un problema en su hogar el cableado de su casa es de muy baja calidad y constantemente hace corto y se le va la luz y solicita el apoyo para poder cambiar la instalación eléctrica de su casa y evitar de esta manera que algún corto circuito le dañe alguno de sus aparatos eléctricos.
texts.en: Misael, 34, has worked as a line production operator in a factory in his town for a year.  He is divorced and lives with a 3 year-old child that his wife left in his care.  He wants to be a good father, and he dreams of seeing his son grow and being able to provide him with a university degree.  This way, his son could have a better quality of life than the one they have now.  Misael has a problem with his house.  The electric wires in his house are of very bad quality, and they frequently short out and cause the lights to go out.  He is requesting a loan so that he can rewire his house and avoid the short circuits  that are damaging his electrical appliances.

loans.use: to repair the electrical system in his house

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan de 66 años es casado y vive en una colonia de la localidad, el es pensionado por parte del seguro social y tiene una necesidad en su hogar por la cual solicita el apoyo; su casa requiere que se cambie la instalcion electrica ya que constantemente se hace corto corcuito y se queda sin luz, el tiene la preocupacion de que si no hace el cambio de los cables le pueda dañar algun aparato electrico que a base de tanto esfuerzo a comprado o lo que aun es peor puede ocasionar un incendio en su casa y aparte de las perdidas materiales puedan sufrir alguna perdida humana; agradece de antemano el apoyo que le pueda ser brindado.
texts.en: Juan, 66, is married and lives in a local neighborhood.  He’s retired and receives social security.  He has a need at home that requires your help.  He wants to rewire it because he’s constantly having short circuits and being left without electricity.  He’s worried that if the wiring isn’t replaced the home  appliances that he’s acquired after so much effort may become damaged.  Worse than that, it could cause a fire at home which not only will lead to material losses but could also cause a loss of life.  He gives thanks in advance for any support he may be granted.

loans.use: to rewire his house.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Doña Faustina es una mujer de 62 años de edad madre soltera con siete  hijos 4 de ellos son hombres que están casados,  tres mujer dos ya casadas y una soltera la cual vive con ella en Sololá. 
Una mujer trabajadora que le gusta prosperar en la vida, ella actualmente tiene  una tienda de consumo y cafetería vendiendo snacks, bebidas frías y calientes, refacciones y mas  a los estudiantes de una universidad en Sololá.
Ella empezó esta actividad desde hace 12 años teniendo el apoyo de sus hijas ya que lastimosamente tuvo la separación de su esposo desde hace muchos años pero no fue un obstáculo para seguir prosperando en la vida.
Ella cuenta que tuvo la oportunidad de tener otra tienda de consumo en el mercado local, a base de esto tuvo que tomar el capital de su tienda y cafetería en la universidad viendo la necesidad de invertir mas capital a base de un préstamo de Q 8,000.00 para comprar mas mercadería para su tienda y cafetería y mejorar sus ingresos familiares.
Entre sus sueños y metas es capitalizar mas su negocio ampliándolo o a  lo mejor abrir otro negocio.
texts.en:
Faustina is a 62-year-old woman who is a single mother of seven children.  Four of them are boys who are married, three are girls two of which are married and one is still single and living with her in Sololá.  She’s a hardworking woman who likes to make progress in life.  She currently has a grocery store and cafeteria where she sells snacks, cold and hot beverages, refreshments and others to students at a university in Sololá.  

She started this business 12 years ago with help from her daughters since sadly she separated from her husband many years ago.  However, that wasn’t an obstacle to continue making life progress.

She relates that she got the opportunity of having another grocery store in the local market and to do so she had to take capital from her store and cafeteria at the university but still needs capital to invest and needs a Q 8,000.00 loan to buy merchandise for her store and cafeteria to improve her family income.  Among her dreams is to better capitalize her business and expanding it or perhaps to open another business.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is 54 years old and is a married man from the town of Cauayan City in the province of Isabela. He and his wife have both been farmers for six years. They primarily grow rice to sell. 

Alfredo does his best to improve their business and take care of their seven children. At this time, Alfredo is requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase quality seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies. He hopes to have a bigger farm in the future. He also hopes to help improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase quality seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is married with one child.  She is 32 years old and lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Mary Ann owns a sari-sari store to earn a living, and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns 3000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 8000 PHP to purchase more stock, such as shampoo, toothpaste and beverages, for her general store .

Mary Ann has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Mary Ann hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock, such as shampoo, toothpaste and beverages, for her general store.

location.town: Liloy-Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor is 50 years old and lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban. He is single without children. 

Nestor has a store that sells a variety of products. He has had this business for 8 years. He requested a loan to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Nestor has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, he hopes to save in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Askicyn005036

texts.en:
Brendita, age 30, is a rice farmer. From this business, she is able to earn about PhP 25,000 every harvest season. She is grateful that her income allows her to help sustain the financial needs of her children and support the family's daily needs. She and her husband have four children. She dreams of lifting her family from poor living conditions, which is why she works hard in the family rice field. 

Brendita is presently requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 45,000 to buy rice seedlings, fertilizers, and insecticides for her rice field. She is confident that the amount she has requested will allow her to further grow her business.

loans.use: to buy rice seedlings, fertilizers, and insecticides for her rice field

loans.name: Neria

texts.en:
Neria is 40 years old and lives in Segatic Diot, Clarin, and is married with 2 children. 

Neria has a store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Neria has been a member of PMPC for 6 mos. In the future, she hopes to save in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Sok Ly

texts.en:
Sok Ly, age 32 and widowed, is a weaver. She resides with her mother and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in her weaving business for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her mother is a rice farmer who earns about $2 each day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Sok Ly is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase silk thread to use for weaving. This purchase will help her produce more silk cloth to offer for sale and to earn more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and to help her children earn Bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase silk thread to use for weaving

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María Elena de cuarenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida Herber  y sus tres hijas en casa propia; ella se dedica a la venta de coco en un lugar muy concurrido de personas, tiene varios años con el pequeño negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia valiosa en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, es muy conocida en la zona y ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefieren porque su producto es de calidad y a precios accesibles además de un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes; María es una mujer dedicada a su labor, enérgica, y muy luchadora siempre esta al frente de la situación buscando alternativas que le ayuden a encontrar un camino al  éxito pues sabe que así tendrá un futuro mas prospero, como toda buena comerciante quiere realizar una nueva inversión para extender el negocio pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cocos por mayor. María Elena tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Maria Elena, 44, lives in her own home with her life partner, Herber, and their 3 daughters.  She has a business selling coconuts that is located in a very busy spot.  She has had this small business for a number of years, and so has valuable experience in retail trade that allows her to obtain the best earnings.  She is very well-known in the neighborhood, and she already has a lot of customers who prefer her business because of the quality products that she has.  In addition, she offers affordable prices and unequalled service, and is always ready to serve her customers.  Maria is a woman who is very dedicated to her work.  She is energetic and very tenacious, and she is always out in front of the situation, seeking alternatives that will help her to find a path to success.  She knows that this way she will have a more prosperous future.  

Like all good merchants, she wants to make a new investment to expand her business.  However, she lacks the capital to do this.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy coconuts at wholesale.  Maria Elena has good credit references, and is very responsible.  She is certain that she will be able to pay off the debt, and at the same time bring economic security to her household.

loans.use: to buy coconuts at wholesale

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en: Jessie is 22 years old and is married with one child. He is a farmer working in the Philippines, and he earned a net income of PHP 30,000 with his last crop. Right now, Jessie is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 25,000 to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers and rice seedlings. He hopes that he can get his requested loan so he can sustain his rice production.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers and rice seedlings

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
Sary, age 40, earns an income from cultivating rice and fattening pigs. She earns about $2 per day and has operated her businesses for more than 10 years. She lives with her husband and their three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Her husband (shown with her in the picture) is a motor taxi driver who earns about $5 each day. One of their children is employed in a garment factory and earns $3 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Sary is requesting a loan of $1,000 in order to purchase cattle to raise and sell. By doing so, she will earn additional income to help her support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her piggery and to send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes eventually to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Saran

texts.en:
Saran, age 21, operates a grocery store business. She has run her business for over a year and earns about $10 per day. She lives with her husband and their one child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Her husband helps her run the business. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Saran is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase an assortment of groceries and beverages to offer for sale. This purchase will help her earn more profit. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and ensure her child's education. Moreover, she hopes eventually to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of groceries and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: La señora Marisol tiene 23 años estudio a hasta tercero básico, por que sus padres no pudieron brindarle apoyo para que continuara sus estudios, otra razón fue la distancia en la que vivía en esos tiempos en carahota todavía no existía escuelas que pasaran de ese nivel, pece a estas dificultades doña Marisol siempre trabajo para ayudar a sus demás hermanos, actualmente esta casada con Fabián  tiene tres hijos ambos trabajan arduamente para darles un mejor futuro a sus niños y así puedan estudiar, para poder acceder a mejores oportunidades económicas buscan siempre ampliar sus plantaciones, por esta razón doña Marisol necesita dinero  para la compra de semillas de banano, de esta forma la familia ampliara sus ingresos y podrá cumplir algunos de sus objetivos entre ellos enviar a sus hijos a la universidad algún día y darles la oportunidad que ellos no pudieron conseguir.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marisol is 23 years old. She studied until third grade, because her parents could not support her in order for her to continue with her studies. Another reason was the distance where she was living, there were no schools in Carahota back then that offered higher levels.

Despite these difficulties, Mrs. Marisol always worked to help the rest of her brothers. She is currently married to Fabián, she has three children. They both work hard to give their children a better future so that they can study.

To have access to better economic opportunities, they always try to expand their plantations. This is why Mrs. Marisol needs money to buy banana seeds. In this way, the family will increase its income and will be able to meet some of their goals, like sending their children to the university some day and giving them the opportunity they could never have.

loans.use: to buy banana seeds.

loans.name: Clifton

texts.es: Clifton tiene 46 años de edad, es casado y vive con su conyugue en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida.  Clifton siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, estuvo un tiempo vendiendo solo ropa, y hace 3 años decidió establecer una tiendita de productos comestibles y variedades. El vende productos de abarrotería (granos básicos, productos enlatados, productos de limpieza, huevos, dulces, carnes, lácteos, sandalias, presto barba, champú etc), ropa, repuestos para bicicletas y comida para animales y otros. Clifton ha solicitado un préstamo por 16,000 Lempiras para surtir el negocio de productos de abarrotería, granos básicos y repuestos para bicicletas. Con esta inversión aumentara el inventario y las ventas. Sus planes son: convertirse en una bodega de abarrotes y  abrir un taller de reparación de bicicletas ya que es una zona donde se utiliza mucho la bicicleta como medio de transporte y así podrá mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Clifton, 46, is married living with his spouse in the municipality of Tela, Atlántida.  Clifton has always been a merchant.  For a time he sold clothes and three years ago decided to open a small grocery store selling foodstuffs and miscellany.  He sells grocery items (basic grains, canned goods, cleaning supplies, eggs, candy, meat, dairy products, sandals, shaving cream, shampoo, etc.), clothes, bicycle spare parts, animal feed and others.

Clifton has requested a 16,000 Lempira loan to stock his store with groceries, basic grains and bicycle spare parts.  With this investment he’ll increase his inventory and sales.  His plans are to become a grocery warehouse and to open a bicycle repair shop since it’s a zone where bicycles are widely used as a means of transportation and he’ll be able to improve his income and his family’s quality of life this way.

loans.use: to buy basic staples to stock his store.

loans.name: Loly

texts.en: Loly, age 59, lives in the village of Nagrumbuan with her husband. To earn a living, Loly owns and operates a farming business. Her main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for more than 20 years and earns approximately a net income of 30,000 PHP every crop season. Loly needs this business as a source of income in order to provide for her family's daily needs. Right now she would like to request a loan in the amount of 38,000 PHP in order to purchase seeds, insecticides and fertilizers for her farming business.

loans.use: purchase seeds, insecticides and fertilizers for her farming business.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es: El señor Efraín de 29 años de edad estado civil soltero, vive en una comunidad rural 1er Toncoli hacia el norte de Colomi con una instrucción de nivel primaria. Efraín es una persona joven muy responsable con sus obligaciones y actividades según que manifiestan sus vecinos del domicilio, se dedica a la actividad agrícola dentro del año, tiene ingresos económicos de la venta de papa y oca que también les ayuda de esta forma a sus sobrinos que son de escasos recursos. El joven Efraín nos cuenta que recientemente hizo terminar la obra fina de su vivienda lo cual invirtió todo el ahorro que tenía y le falto dinero para compra de insumos agrícolas ya que tiene parcelas preparadas para la siembra, el necesita ayuda para comprar abono orgánico (gallinaza) y semilla de papa. Por último él tiene mucha esperanza de mejorar su vida, él quiere mejorar y crecer en su negocio para que en un futuro también él pueda tener familia y brindarles todo el fruto de su esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Mr. Efrain is 29 years old and single. He lives in a rural community, 1st Toncoli, north of Colomi. He finished primary school. Efrain is a young and very responsible person with his obligations and activities, according to his neighbors. He works in agriculture during the year, his income comes from selling potato and oca [Oxalis tuberosa] and he also helps in this way his nephews, which have limited economic resources.

Young Efrain mentions that he just got the finishing work in his house done, in which he invested all his savings, and he is lacking money to buy agricultural supplies. Now that he has parcels ready for sowing, he needs help to buy organic fertilizer (chicken manure) and potato seeds.

Finally, he is very hopeful that his life will improve. He wants to improve and grow in his business, in order to be able to have a family in the future and to give them all his efforts' fruits.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer (chicken manure) and potato seeds.

loans.name: Albina

texts.es: Albina de 32 años de edad, es una persona humilde y muy trabajadora vive en Cochabamba estudio hasta el nivel primario, es casada de lo cual tienen 4 hijos pequeños, Albina no pudo culminar sus estudios ya que ella vivía en una provincia muy alejada y no había centros educativos, Albina se dedica a la venta de carne de res ya que ella vende de lunes a viernes, su esposo trabaja de servicio de transporte de chofer ya que él viaja constantemente para poder ayudar con los ingresos en su familia y su esposa sola se hace cargo de sus hijos. El presente crédito que solicita es para la compra de ganado y poder carnear para su comercialización ya que no cuenta con mucho capital para su comercialización Albina quiere mejorar sus ingresos familiares y poder dar lo mejor a sus hijos ya que quiere incrementar y dar una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Albina, 32, is a humble, very hardworking woman living in Cochabamba; she attended elementary school.  She’s married and has four children.  Albina was unable to finish her schooling because she lived in a distant province that had no schools. 

Albina works selling beef Monday to Friday.  Her husband works as a driver providing transportation services.  He travels constantly to help with family income and his wife cares for their children by herself.

The present loan she’s requesting is to buy cattle to butcher and sell the meat because she does not have much capital available to sell.  Albina wants to improve family income to give her children the best since she wants to improve and give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es: El Sr. Dionicio de 29 años de edad, se dedica a la Agricultura, produce papa en su misma Comunidad donde vive, por circunstancias de la vida se fue a la República Argentina para poder tener un mayor Ingreso Económico, pues de esa manera puede ahorrar un poco mas y Terminar de Construir su casita, pues de esa manera ofrecerles a sus hijos una mejor condición de vida y un estatus o nivel social un poco mejor. El cliente es muy humilde y sencillo, gracias al esfuerzo que hicieron tanto el cliente como su esposa pudieron comprarse un casita, además sus Suegros le apoyan prestándole su Terreno para que pueda sembrar una sola vez al año, pues esto hace que su ingreso por una parte sea segura, para esta actividad el cliente lo destina 6 meses del año y la otra mitad se va a la Argentina como se menciono anteriormente.
texts.en:
Dionicio, 29, works in agriculture.  He grows potatoes in the same community where he lives.  Due to life’s circumstances he went to Argentina in order to earn higher income because it’s possible to save a bit that way and finish building his house and offer his children better living conditions and a slightly improved status or standard of living.

He is quite humble and unassuming.  Thanks to his and his wife’s efforts they were able to buy a house.  In addition, his parents-in-law help them by lending them the farmland he can plant on once a year which insures part of his income.  He spends six months a year in this activity and as mentioned above spends the other half year in Argentina.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvements to her kitchen where she makes tortillas, as well as to invest in expanding her snack shop.

loans.name: Benedict Group

texts.fr: La cliente Pendeza est secrétaire du groupe de crédit Bénédiction, Femme dynamique, cliente au 15e cycle de crédit. Elle est mère de 7 enfants. Son mari est actuellement chômeur (sans emploi). Elle est vendeuse de divers. Elle a commencé son business avec son fond propre reçu de son mari, Elle expose ses marchandises au marché public du secteur Alanine. Environs 8 ans, elle exerce cette activité génératrice de revenu. Avec le crédit de l’IMF Hekima, la cliente souhaite accroitre son chiffre d’affaire en achetant les articles divers (Omo, sucre, pétrole, lotion de beauté, Fanta, souliers, etc.). Le défi actuel dans son activité, c’est la multiplicité de taxes dit-elle. Dans l’avenir, elle ambitionne accroitre son entreprise, construire confortablement, scolariser ses enfants et voir son mari trouver du travail. Elle remercie l’IMF Hekima, pour les crédits réguliers qu’elle reçoit sans aucune garantie matérielle, car grâce à ces crédits, elle parvient à subvenir aux multiples besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
The client, Pendeza, is the secretary of the Bénédiction loan group. A dynamic woman, she's on her 15th loan cycle. She is the mother of 7, and her husband is currently unemployed. She sells various items and started her business with money she received from her husband. She sells her goods at the public market in Alanine. She has been working on this revenue generating activity for 8 years. 

With the loan from IMF Hekima, the client would like to grow her sales volume buying various items (Omo [soap], sugar, gas, beauty lotion, Fanta, shoes, etc.). She says that her current business challenge is all the taxes she has to pay. 

In the future, she would like to grow her business, to build (a home) with ease, educate her children, and see her husband find work. 

She thanks IMF Hekima for the regular loans that she receives without collateral because it's due to these loans that she can meet the many needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy various items (Omo [soap], sugar, gas, beauty lotion, Fanta, shoes, etc.).

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is 24 years old and lives in Sana'a, Yemen. He is a married man and a student in a university. He has experienced many difficulties in life. However, his desire to work and make progress has allowed him to overcome these difficulties. 

For five years, he has been working hard to manage his small business selling ladies' clothes. He started the business with the support of his dad. Thanks to his good customer service, he has gained a very good customer base. 

With the aim of stocking his business, he would like to take out a youth loan of 300,000 Yemeni rials from AMB. This loan will allow him to buy more ladies' clothes for resale, such as skirts, dresses, blouses, robes and shirts. This will enable him to offer his customers a larger variety of products. He hopes to be able to continue making the income he needs to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more ladies' clothes for resale.

loans.name: Khadog

texts.en:
Khadog is a philosophy teacher and a very hard-working woman, 100 percent dedicated to her work. Right now, she lives in Aden, Yemen. She has four daughters. 

She has a house and intends to build a second floor on her house. So, she needs a loan of 399,999.96 YER from AMB to buy construction materials. 

She wants to keep working very hard to be able to help her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her house

loans.name: Ala

texts.en: Ala is 28 years old, single and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He has compeleted an electrician diploma. He is characterized by working hard, so he is an employer currently.  He lives in a rented house, and he intends to buy supplies for his house. He applied for a youth loan from AMB to buy furniture for his house. He hopes to have a savings account in a bank so that he can buy a car and get married.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his house.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is 35 years old. He has a Bachelor degree. 

Mahmoud sells honey. He works hard growing beehives. He has been in this business for 15 years, and during this time he has been striving to offer his clients the best quality of honey. He is professional and treats his clients well. He likes his job because it allows him to generate financial income to cover the expenses for his home. 

Mahmoud applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to buy beehives to grow and sell honey to his clients. He hopes to expand his business around his area.

loans.use: to buy beehives to grow and sell honey to his clients.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
Don José tiene 51 años de edad, es casado y tiene cinco hijos.  Él se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos, desde que tenia 10 años de edad, su padre fue quien le enseño esta actividad. Para adquirir sus productos se desplaza en una carreta halada por bueyes a cuatro kilómetros hasta llegar al lugar donde compra lo que necesita para sus cultivos.

El prestamos es para comprar ocho sacos de abono, herbicidas, y para pago de mano de obra y lo que sobre lo utilizara para sembrar pasto para el ganado, comprar sacate y pago de mano de obra.  Con la inversión, tendrá todo lo que necesita para realizar sus trabajos y obtener ingresos suficientes que le permitan cultivar mayor cantidad de maíz y maicillo con el objetivo de comprar un vehiculo para trabajar.
texts.en:
José, 51, is married and has five children.  He has worked growing basic grains since he was 10-years-old; his father taught him this activity.  To acquire his supplies he drives an ox-pulled cart four kilometers to the place where he buys what he needs for his crops.

The loan is to buy 8 sacks of manure, herbicide and to pay labor costs; any funds left over will be used to plant grass for the cattle, to buy grass and to pay labor costs.  With this investment he’ll have everything he needs to do his work and earn sufficient income to grow larger quantities of corn and sorghum with the goal of buying a vehicle for work.

loans.use: to buy 8 sacks of manure, herbicide, grass and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Immer Josue

texts.es:
Immer tiene 24 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos.  Vive en un terreno propiedad de su papá en donde ha construido su casa. Él tiene cerca de cuatro años de dedicarse al negocio del reciclaje de chatarra, antes de eso era mecánico, reparaba escapes y radiadores de vehículos. Pero; al ver que mucha chatarra le quedaba a él, se inclino por ese negocio. Es un comerciante muy optimista, porque el reciclaje no siempre obtiene buenas ganancias. Pero, Immer también comercializa sandia, cubriendo diferentes rutas, sale de su casa a las 4:00 a.m. 

Immer actualmente recicla oro, tiene diferentes rutas, posee clientes preferentes, eso lo hace diferenciarse de los demás que se dedican al mismo negocio. 

El prestamos que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para cancelar una deuda con la institución y la otra parte para comprar material y revenderlo en la joyerías; debido a que a veces con un solo cliente obtiene buenas ganancias y en este momento no posee suficiente dinero para trabajar. Con el préstamo espera cubrir una nueva zona geográfica, su deseo es comprar una motocicleta, ya que es mucho más fácil para comprar oro según lo manifiesta él, pero lo que mas desea es comprar su propio terreno y construir su casa ahí.
texts.en:
Immer, 24, is married and has two children.  He lives on land belonging to his father that he built his house on.  He’s been working recycling materials for about four years.  Before that he was a mechanic and worked repairing vehicle mufflers and radiators.  However, noting that working recycling materials was a good fit for him, he tended more towards this business.  He’s a very optimistic merchant because recycling doesn’t always produce high profits but Immer also sells watermelons along a variety of routes; he leaves home at 4am.  He’s currently recycling gold.  He has various routes and has special, regular customers which differentiate him from others who are in the same kind of business.

The loan he’s asking from Fundación Campo is to repay a debt with the institution and the other part is to buy material to resell to jewelry stores because sometimes he earns good profits with just one customer and he currently doesn’t have enough money to work.

He hopes the loan will help him cover new territory.  He wants to buy a motorcycle because it’s much easier to buy gold according to him but what he most wants is to buy a piece of land of his own and build his house there.

loans.use: to repay a loan and to buy merchandise to resell to jewelry stores.

loans.name: Houweida

texts.en:
"My name is Houwaida. I've been a borrower with Al Majmoua for 4 years, and each year is an improvement is over the last. I've been in this business for 15 years, and it is going well, thank God. I have six children. Through the success of my business, I've been able to help my oldest son become an architect. I would like to use this loan to strengthen my business. This is the time for me to stock my inventory with winter clothes."

Houweida's successful store is as busy as it is colorful. She used to import these goods cheaply from Syria, but the fighting there has caused her to import from Beirut, instead. Prices are now more expensive than they used to be. This loan allows her to purchase winter clothing inventory for the coming season.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothes for her inventory

loans.name: Total Group

texts.en:
This group is called Total and consists of three men who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 240,000 YER from AMB.

Jamal is a 52-year-old married man with six children. He is a driver who tries to offer his family a good life.

Jamal lives in a rented house. He needs to make several improvements to his house. He doesn't have the necessary money to make the improvements, so he is requesting a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB to be able to buy a TV for his house. He hopes to have a house and give his children a good education.

loans.use: to buy a TV for his house.

loans.name: Amarjargal

texts.en:
Amarjargal is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two children, ages 6 and 2 years. They live in their own wooden house in Kherlen, the largest city of eastern province of Mongolia. Amarjargal has worked as a court comptroller since 2004 beside his taxi business. His wife, Altansuvd, 29, has been working at a local secondary school as a teacher. 

In 2006, they got married and built their current house. In that moment, as new couples, expecting a baby, they had a problem with money. So  Amarjargal decided to use cheap materials to complete his house. As he planned, they completed their house, but house gets colder than others. As Amarjargal said, it is obvious when weather gets colder, especially in winter; the hoarfrost forms on the surface of the walls. So they need to use more coal to stay warm. This is why Mongolia is one of the worst countries for air pollution. 

Amarjargal is requesting MNT 3,000,000 to insulate the walls and roof. By doing this, his house will be warm and comfortable and they will burn less coal than usual.

loans.use: To insulate the walls and roof.

loans.name: Igor Pablo

texts.es: El solicitante  Igor pablo, curso hasta la secundaria ,  es  de estado civil casado  mayor de edad vive   con su esposa  tiene dos hijos de edad  escolar  radican  en Patacamaya en  Zona central  en casa de familiar  de la esposa ,ya que ellos se casaron a una edad  mayor motivo por el cual  empezaron con su actividad principal que es una tienda de imprenta, filmaciones y flete de vestidos de novias de todos los modelos , tiene una experiencia de 5 años. en el trabajo de imprenta,  el necesita capital para invertir y ampliar mas su negocio  en todo caso  para   la compra  de cámaras  fotográficas  de  los últimos modelos para cambiar sus herramientas  así  para poder salir para cualquier  acontecimientos , y así crecer  mas la familia ya que  son de recursos económicos bajos pero ellos  son considerados en la Zona como personas trabajadoras, responsables y humildes y ellos tienen visión de mejorar su vida, por lo cual se recomienda a los señores.
texts.en:
The borrower Igor Pablo finished secondary education. He is married, of legal age, he lives with his wife and he has two children that attend school. They live in Patacamaya in a central area. The house he lives in belongs to one of his wife's relatives. Because they got married at a late age, they started their main business, which is a store where they print, film and rent wedding dresses of all kinds.

He has a 5-year experience in the printing business. He needs the capital to invest and expand his business more. In particular, to buy the latest models of photo cameras, in order to change his tools and to be able to attend any type of celebration, improving in this way his family's condition since they have limited economic resources. They are however known in the area as hard-working, responsible and humble people and they have the vision of improving their life. This is why they are recommended.

loans.use: to buy photo cameras.

loans.name: Erika

texts.ru:
В этот раз Эрике понадобилась сумма в размере 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы сменить и разнообразить товар под осенне-зимний сезон, а именно купить женские свитера, блузки и юбки. 
Эрика надеется за счет полученных от КИВА средств увеличить свою валовую выручку и доход.
texts.en: Erika is seeking a new loan in the amount of 10,000 Ukrainian Hryvnia in order to change and diversify her inventory for the autumn-winter season, specifically by buying women's sweaters, blouses and skirts. Erika hopes that the Kiva loan will allow her to increase her gross revenue and her profit.

loans.use: to buy women's sweaters, blouses, and skirts

loans.name: Banco Mujer Kábata Group

texts.es:
Merari es la presidenta de Banco Mujer Kábata, tiene 28 años, una niña de 5 años, y vive en unión libre hace 9 años. Tanto ella como su compañero trabajan en una pequeña finca propia donde siembran plátano. Está actividad productiva es la única fuente de ingresos para la familia. El crédito se va invertir en la compra de insumos como, abonos, fertilizantes, fungicidas, bolsas otros. Este es el quinto crédito que ella solicita, y han sido de gran beneficio para su negocio, permitiéndole salir adelante, y hasta ayudarse a pagar sus estudios universitarios. 
Ella tiene sus metas muy bien definidas, quiere aumentar producción de plátano, cultivar otros productos, y terminar sus estudios universitarios. Todo esto para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija. 
Junto a Merari, a 7 socias mas en el grupo que van a invertir en actividades agropecuarias.
texts.en:
Merari is the president of Banco Mujer Kábata. She is 28 years old, has a five-year-old daughter and has been in a civil union for nine years. Both she and her partner work in their own small farm where they grow bananas. This activity is the only source of income for the family. 

The loan will be invested in the purchase of inputs such as compost, fertilizer, fungicide, bags and others. This is the fifth loan that she has requested. The loans have greatly benefited her business, enabling her to get ahead and even helping her pay for college.

Merari has well-defined goals. She wants to increase the banana production, cultivate other crops and finish her university studies. All of this is so she can offer her daughter a better quality of life.

Alongside Merari, there are seven other members in the group who will invest in agricultural activities.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizer, fungicide, bags and other inputs.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is 43 years old. She is married with four children. She and her family live happily in a village and have a plan to raise their standard of living. Farming is one of their major sources of income; they plant and harvest rice to sell. She has been in this business for more than four years and usually earns a profit of PHP 30,000 in each harvest season. At this time, Virginia is asking for a loan of PHP 45,000 to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides, and to pay for the labor needed for rice planting. She and her family believe that this loan will be an enormous help to their hope of increasing their yield.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides, and to pay for the labor needed for rice planting

loans.name: Koemsan

texts.en:
Koemsan (in the photo) and her husband, Prum, live in a Phnom Penh suburb. They have five children--two sons and three daughters. All of their children are in school. 

Koemsan sells fish that her husband raises and fishes for. Prum is a fisherman and his business also is fish farming. In addition, the couple grows rice when rice farming season comes. 

Koemsan is requesting a loan of US $1,500 to assist in her husband’s fish farming business by buying materials needed in his business.

loans.use: To assist in her husband’s fish farming business by buying materials needed in his business.

loans.name: Kanhchana

texts.en:
Kanhchana (in the photo) is 25 years old and her husband, Sok Khoeurn, is 25 years old. They live in Phnom Penh suburb. They have been married since 2008 and just have one young daughter.
